alert.note: Alert for Grant; Owen; Pendleton (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued January 03 at 10:37AM EST until January 03 at 12:45PM EST by NWS Wilmington
info.description: The National Weather Service in Wilmington has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Southeastern Grant County in northern Kentucky... Southeastern Owen County in northern Kentucky... Southern Pendleton County in northern Kentucky... * Until 1245 PM EST. * At 1037 AM EST, emergency management reported flash flooding southwest of Owenton, with water over roadways and damage to a bridge. Pendleton County Sheriff also reported numerous areas of flash flooding along roadways through portions of the county. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 0.25 to 0.5 inches in the next hour. While heavy rain is coming to an end, flash flooding will linger through early afternoon. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Emergency management reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that may experience flash flooding include... Williamstown, Falmouth, Morgan, Corinth, Camp Northward, Cordova, Cherry Grove, Marcus, Keefer, Williamstown Lake, Lawrenceville, Goforth, Knoxville, New Columbus, Natlee, Gene Snyder Airport, Elk Lake, Beechwood, Mckinneysburg and Harmony. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...0.25-0.5 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life. To report flash flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
